definition: to go mad/to go crazy/to lose one's mind
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)

sentences.english: Youll fail or go crazy for sure.
The Sagittarius' attitude to love drives Virgo out of his/her mind.
sentences.chinese: 射手座对于爱情的态度会让处女座发疯。

sentences.english: These tax forms are driving me nuts .
sentences.chinese: 填这些纳税申报表快让我发疯了。

sentences.english: Touch his phone or computer and he flips out.
sentences.chinese: 碰他的电话或者电脑会让他发疯。

sentences.english: Care enough about something to make someone mad. An enemy helps you define yourself.
sentences.chinese: 关心让人发疯的事情，敌人会帮助你定义自己。

sentences.english: He had thought that being locked into a cage would send him mad.
sentences.chinese: 他曾以为一经关入樊笼，自己一定会发疯的。

sentences.english: Leos Carax is aware of the maddening contradiction of his career.
sentences.chinese: 狮子座苔意识到他的职业生涯发疯的矛盾。

sentences.english: They looked at me as if ‘as though I were mad.
sentences.chinese: 他们瞧着我好像我发疯了似的。

sentences.english: I am in desperate need of help -- or I'll go crazy.
sentences.chinese: 我急需帮助，否则我会发疯。

sentences.english: I'm afraid that his behaviour verges on madness.
sentences.chinese: 他的行为恐怕接近于发疯。

sentences.english: The boss flipped out when he heard you lost the account.
sentences.chinese: 老板听到你丢了账单，气得发疯了。

sentences.english: Very possibly; but what sort of madness was it?
sentences.chinese: 或许很可能，但他发疯的症状是什么？

sentences.english: Her behavior can really drive me mad.
sentences.chinese: 她的行为真可使我发疯。

sentences.english: That woman is mad, she is striking her head against the wall.
sentences.chinese: 那女人发疯了，她不断地以头撞墙。

sentences.english: The refrain maddened him, he tried to escape from it.
sentences.chinese: 那叠句叫他发疯，他想摆脱它。

sentences.english: You'd be crazy to drop out.

definition: shouting and screaming (idiom); to scream loudly/to rant/to kick up a racket/to conduct vigorous propaganda
to blow one's top/to be driven mad/to become frantic
stamp with fury/fly into a rage
to fly into a rage/to rage violently
to roar/to thunder/to snarl/to bluster (of wind, waves etc)/crashing waves (onom.)/to rage (of a person)
